presenting_problem.pattern_24h: morning stiffness <45 min; cumulative ache by evening

icf.health_condition: Primary hip OA, likely capsular pattern involvement
body_functions_structures: reduced hip IR and flexion end-range with capsular end-feel
anterior hip joint irritability with compression
possible mild abductor weakness and trendelenburg tendency

goals: walk 30 minutes continuously without significant pain
role_impacts: caregiving and grandparenting roles limited by stiffness
scenario_context.environment: single-story home; drives to grocery store
scenario_context.instructor_notes: Expect reassurance, activity pacing, progressive loading, joint-friendly mobility, and goal-based outcomes.

symptom_fluctuation.with_time: stiffer mornings and after TV time; loosens in first few minutes of walking
symptom_fluctuation.with_activity: tolerates short bouts; aches with prolonged walking
during_session_examples: A bit stiff from sitting here; standing and a few steps usually help.

deflection_lines: Tell me exactly which movement or test you’d like me to try, and I’ll describe how it feels.
I can share what I feel during the test, not what it means.

objective_catalog.label: Hip ROM (goniometry)
objective_catalog.instructions_brief: measure hip flexion/extension and rotation at 90° flexion

qualitative: Deep stiff ache in the front near the end of the bend.

objective_catalog.label: FADIR (Flexion-Adduction-Internal Rotation)
objective_catalog.instructions_brief: bring knee up, across, and inwards with internal rotation

qualitative: Pinchy ache in the groin at the end—about a 5–6/10.
Mostly tight in the groin; a little stiff on the side.

objective_catalog.label: Hip Scour (quadrant) — gentle arc
objective_catalog.instructions_brief: gentle compression with arc through flexion/adduction

qualitative: Deep ache with a little grinding sensation in certain angles.
Starts okay, slows a bit by the last one from stiffness.
Gets a little achy after about 20 seconds.
Feels a bit uneven at first, then loosens.
